content:
LocalServiceSecuritySettings Class

In this Article

Provides local service security properties that can be set.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class LocalServiceSecuritySettings

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • LocalServiceSecuritySettings

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

This class contains the local security settings used by the SecurityBindingElement to build the security channel. These settings are local to the service and are not represented in the service's security policy.

Constructors summary

LocalServiceSecuritySettings()

Initializes a new instance of the LocalServiceSecuritySettings class.

Properties summary

DetectReplays

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether replay detection is enabled on the service.
InactivityTimeout

Gets or sets the duration to wait before the channel is closed due to inactivity.
IssuedCookieLifetime

Gets or sets the lifetime for the SecurityContextSecurityToken that the service issues for the client.
MaxCachedCookies

Gets or sets the maximum number of SecurityContextSecurityTokens that the service allows to cache at once.
MaxClockSkew

Gets or sets the maximum allowable time difference between the system clocks of the two parties that are communicating.
MaxPendingSessions

Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent security sessions that are established with the server for which it has issued a session token but for which no application messages are sent.
MaxStatefulNegotiations

Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent security negotiations with clients that the service can participate in.
NegotiationTimeout

Gets or sets the maximum duration of the security negotiation phase between client and service.
NonceCache

Gets or sets the cache for the local service security settings.
ReconnectTransportOnFailure

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether security sessions attempt to reconnect after transport failures.
ReplayCacheSize

Gets or sets the size of the nonce cache used for replay detection.
ReplayWindow

Gets or sets the maximum amount of time within which the service can accept a message.
SessionKeyRenewalInterval

Gets or sets the lifetime of a key used in a security session. When this interval expires the key is automatically renewed.
SessionKeyRolloverInterval

Gets or sets the time interval after key renewal for which the previous session key is valid on incoming messages during a key renewal.
TimestampValidityDuration

Gets or sets the maximum duration of time that messages are valid when sent by the service. If the client receives the service's message after this duration, it discards the message.

Methods summary

Clone()

Creates a new instance of this class from the current instance.

Constructors

  • LocalServiceSecuritySettings()

    Initializes a new instance of the LocalServiceSecuritySettings class.

    public LocalServiceSecuritySettings ();

    Example

    This example shows how to use the default constructor. 

    Dim settings As New LocalServiceSecuritySettings()

    LocalServiceSecuritySettings settings =
    new LocalServiceSecuritySettings();

Properties

  • DetectReplays

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether replay detection is enabled on the service.

    public bool DetectReplays { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if replay detection is enabled on the service; otherwise, false. The default is true.

    Example

    This example shows how get the value of this property. 

    Dim settings As New LocalServiceSecuritySettings()

         Dim detectReplays = settings.DetectReplays

    LocalServiceSecuritySettings settings =
    new LocalServiceSecuritySettings();

bool detectReplays = settings.DetectReplays;
  • InactivityTimeout

    Gets or sets the duration to wait before the channel is closed due to inactivity.

    public TimeSpan InactivityTimeout { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that represents the duration to wait before the security session with the client is closed due to inactivity. The default is 2 minutes.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The property is set to a value less than 0.

    Remarks

    In a secure conversation session, note that both this property and the ReceiveTimeout property on the binding affect session timeout. The shorter of the two determines when timeouts occur.

    Session settings such as this one are applicable under any of the following conditions:

    • All client credential types for WSDualHttpBinding and NetTcpBinding.

    • If <reliableSession> element is enabled.

    • If <reliableSession> element is not enabled, on WSHttpBinding with UserName = true or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.windows%2A> = true.

      Session settings such as this one are not applicable under any of the following conditions:

    • For BasicHttpBinding.

    • For NetNamedPipeBinding.

    • If <reliableSession> element is not enabled, on WSHttpBinding with ClientCertificate = true or with none of the ClientCredentials properties set to true.

    Example

    This example shows how get the InactivityTimeout value. 

    Dim inactivityTimeout As TimeSpan = settings.InactivityTimeout

    TimeSpan inactivityTimeout = settings.InactivityTimeout;
  • IssuedCookieLifetime

    Gets or sets the lifetime for the SecurityContextSecurityToken that the service issues for the client.

    public TimeSpan IssuedCookieLifetime { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that represents the lifetime for new security cookies. The default is 10 hours.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The property is set to a value less than 0.

    Remarks

    When the service issues secure conversation cookie tokens to the client, their validity period is determined by the value of this property.

    Example

    This example shows how to get the IssuedCookieLifetime value. 

    Dim issuedCookieLifetime As TimeSpan = settings.IssuedCookieLifetime

    TimeSpan issuedCookieLifetime = settings.IssuedCookieLifetime;
  • MaxCachedCookies

    Gets or sets the maximum number of SecurityContextSecurityTokens that the service allows to cache at once.

    public int MaxCachedCookies { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The maximum number of secure conversation cookies that can be cached by the service. When this limit is reached the service removes the oldest cached secure conversation cookies to make room for new secure conversation cookies. The default is 1000.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The property is set to a value less than 0.

    Example

    This example shows how to get the MaxCachedCookies value. 

    Dim maxCachedCookies = settings.MaxCachedCookies

    int maxCachedCookies = settings.MaxCachedCookies;
  • MaxClockSkew

    Gets or sets the maximum allowable time difference between the system clocks of the two parties that are communicating.

    public TimeSpan MaxClockSkew { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that represents the maximum allowable time difference between the system clocks of the two parties that are communicating. The default is 5 minutes.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The property is set to a value less than 0.

    Remarks

    The default value for this property is 5 minutes.

    Messages that do not pass the send-time test are rejected.

    This property is used in conjunction with the message timestamp verification and the ReplayWindow property.

    Example

    This example shows how to get the MaxClockSkew value. 

    Dim maxClockSkew As TimeSpan = settings.MaxClockSkew

    TimeSpan maxClockSkew = settings.MaxClockSkew;
  • MaxPendingSessions

    Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent security sessions that are established with the server for which it has issued a session token but for which no application messages are sent.

    public int MaxPendingSessions { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The maximum number of concurrent security sessions. The default is 128.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The property is set to a value less than 0.

    Example

    This example shows how to get the MaxPendingSessions value. 

    Dim maxPendingSessions = settings.MaxPendingSessions

    int maxPendingSessions = settings.MaxPendingSessions;
  • MaxStatefulNegotiations

    Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent security negotiations with clients that the service can participate in.

    public int MaxStatefulNegotiations { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The maximum number of concurrent security negotiations with clients that the service can participate in. The default is 128.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The property is set to a value less than 0.

    Remarks

    Negotiation sessions in excess of this limit are rejected and a SOAP fault is sent back to the client. The client typically must retry later, which allows some time for existing negotiations on the service to complete.

    Example

    This example shows how set the MaxStatefulNegotiations value. 

    Dim maxStatefulNegotiationsNegotiations = settings.MaxStatefulNegotiations

    int maxStatefulNegotiationsNegotiations =
    settings.MaxStatefulNegotiations;
  • NegotiationTimeout

    Gets or sets the maximum duration of the security negotiation phase between client and service.

    public TimeSpan NegotiationTimeout { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that represents the maximum duration of the security negotiation phase between client and service. Any negotiation with the service (for example during message level SPNego or SSL authentication) must complete within this time. The default is 1 minute.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The property is set to a value less than 0.

    Remarks

    If this limit is exceeded, an exception is thrown.

    Example

    This example shows how to get the value of this property. 

    Dim negotiationTimeout As TimeSpan = settings.NegotiationTimeout

    TimeSpan negotiationTimeout = settings.NegotiationTimeout;
  • NonceCache

    Gets or sets the cache for the local service security settings.

    public System.ServiceModel.Security.NonceCache NonceCache { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • NonceCache

      The cache for the local service security settings.

  • ReconnectTransportOnFailure

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether security sessions attempt to reconnect after transport failures.

    public bool ReconnectTransportOnFailure { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if security sessions attempt to reconnect after transport failures; otherwise false. The default is true.

    Remarks

    If this flag is set to true, the service allows the client to send messages that correspond to a single security session over multiple transport connections. This is useful in the case of secure WS-ReliableMessaging because the client requires the session to tolerate transient transport failures.

    Example

    This example shows how to get the value of this property. 

    Dim maxStatefulNegotiations = settings.MaxStatefulNegotiations

    int maxStatefulNegotiations = settings.MaxStatefulNegotiations;
  • ReplayCacheSize

    Gets or sets the size of the nonce cache used for replay detection.

    public int ReplayCacheSize { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The size of the nonce cache used for replay detection. The default is 900,000.

    Remarks

    A nonce is a "number used once".

    If the nonce count is exceeded, the incoming message is rejected and a MessageSecurityException is thrown. Old nonces are removed in a timely manner.

    Example

    This example shows how to get the value of this property. 

    Dim replayCacheSize = settings.ReplayCacheSize

    int replayCacheSize = settings.ReplayCacheSize;
  • ReplayWindow

    Gets or sets the maximum amount of time within which the service can accept a message.

    public TimeSpan ReplayWindow { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that represents the maximum amount of time within which the service can accept a message. The default is 5 minutes.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The property is set to a value less than 0.

    Remarks

    A nonce is a "number used once".

    The service rejects all messages that are sent more than the ReplayWindow duration in the past. Messages that arrive within the ReplayWindow have their nonce checked for uniqueness.

    Example

    This example shows how to get the value of this property. 

    Dim replayWindow As TimeSpan = settings.ReplayWindow

    TimeSpan replayWindow = settings.ReplayWindow;
  • SessionKeyRenewalInterval

    Gets or sets the lifetime of a key used in a security session. When this interval expires the key is automatically renewed.

    public TimeSpan SessionKeyRenewalInterval { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      The time span after which the service requires that the initiator renew the key used for the security session. If the initiator does not renew the key within this time the service sends back a fault to the initiator. The default is 15 hours.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The property is set to a value less than 0.

    Remarks

    Session settings such as this one are applicable under any of the following conditions:

    • All client credential types for WSDualHttpBinding and NetTcpBinding.

    • If <reliableSession> element is enabled.

    • If <reliableSession> element is not enabled, on WSHttpBinding with UserName = true or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.windows%2A> = true.

      Session settings such as this one are not applicable under any of the following conditions:

    • For BasicHttpBinding.

    • For NetNamedPipeBinding.

    • If <reliableSession> element is not enabled, on WSHttpBinding with ClientCertificate = true or with none of the ClientCredentials properties set to true.

    Example

    This example shows how get the value of this property. 

    Dim sessionKeyRenewalInterval As TimeSpan = settings.SessionKeyRenewalInterval

    TimeSpan sessionKeyRenewalInterval =
settings.SessionKeyRenewalInterval;
  • SessionKeyRolloverInterval

    Gets or sets the time interval after key renewal for which the previous session key is valid on incoming messages during a key renewal.

    public TimeSpan SessionKeyRolloverInterval { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      The time interval after key renewal for which the previous session key is valid on incoming messages after a key renewal. The default is 5 minutes.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The property is set to a value less than 0.

    Remarks

    After key renewal, the client and server should always send messages using the most current available key. Both parties can accept incoming messages secured with the previous session key until the rollover time expires.

    Session settings such as this one are applicable under any of the following conditions:

    • All client credential types for WSDualHttpBinding and NetTcpBinding.

    • If <reliableSession> element is enabled.

    • If <reliableSession> element is not enabled, on WSHttpBinding with UserName = true or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.windows%2A> = true.

      Session settings such as this one are not applicable under any of the following conditions:

    • For BasicHttpBinding.

    • For NetNamedPipeBinding.

    • If <reliableSession> element is not enabled, on WSHttpBinding with ClientCertificate = true or with none of the ClientCredentials properties set to true.

    Example

    This example shows how get the SessionKeyRolloverInterval value. 

    Dim rolloverInterval As TimeSpan = settings.SessionKeyRolloverInterval

    TimeSpan rolloverInterval =
    settings.SessionKeyRolloverInterval;
  • TimestampValidityDuration

    Gets or sets the maximum duration of time that messages are valid when sent by the service. If the client receives the service's message after this duration, it discards the message.

    public TimeSpan TimestampValidityDuration { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      The maximum duration of time that messages are valid when sent by the service. The default is 5 minutes.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The property is set to a value less than 0.

    Example

    This example shows how to get the TimestampValidityDuration value. 

    Dim timestampValidityDuration As TimeSpan = settings.TimestampValidityDuration

    TimeSpan timestampValidityDuration =
settings.TimestampValidityDuration;

Methods

  • Clone()

    Creates a new instance of this class from the current instance.

    public System.ServiceModel.Channels.LocalServiceSecuritySettings Clone ();

    Returns

    • LocalServiceSecuritySettings

      A new instance of LocalServiceSecuritySettings.

    Example

    This example shows how to create a new instance of this class from the current instance. 

    Dim localServiceSecuritySettings As LocalServiceSecuritySettings = settings.Clone()

    LocalServiceSecuritySettings
    localServiceSecuritySettings =
settings.Clone();
